mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of the moray eels of the world (Teleostei: Anguilliformes: Muraenidae) 3474

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Muraena anatina Lowe 1838: 192
. (Off Madeira). Neotype , BMNH 1869.3.7.1, designated by
Böhlke et al. 1989: 136
.
Muraena sanctaehelenae Günther 1870: 115
( Saint Helena I., South Atlantic). Holotype (unique), BMNH 1868.3.11.3.

subSubSection.paragraph:
REMARKS: Most recent authors have considered
Muraena sanctaehelenae
a synonym of
M. anatina
. Ben-Tuvia and Golani (1984: 542) pointed out differences in proportions, body color, and vertebral counts and on this basis recognized it as distinct. Böhlke at al. (1989:137) considered those characters insufficiently diagnostic and returned it to synonymy. However, the vertebral count of the holotype and only known specimen (146) is well outside the range of other specimens (151–158), and the color pattern seems distinct ( Böhlke et al. 1989 : fig. 135). If additional specimens confirm these distinctions,
Enchelycore sanctaehelenae
could be recognized as a valid species.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Enchelycore carychroa
Böhlke & Böhlke 1976: 138
, figs. 1–3 ( West of Delaporte Point , Great Bahama Bank, New Providence I. , Bahamas ,
12 ft
). Holotype , ANSP 100000 .

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: Western and Central Atlantic (one questionable record from Fernando Po , w Africa).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Enchelycore kamara
Böhlke & Böhlke 1980a: 173
, figs. 1–3 ( Cook Is. , Tongareva Atoll, on lagoon side of some small islets south of
Molokai I.
, central Pacific ,
3–5 ft
). Holotype , USNM 221161 .

treatmentCitationGroup.materialsCitation:
Jordan & Snyder 1901: 883
,fig. 20 ( Wakanoura , Japan ). Holotype , SU 6480 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
REMARKS: The holotype and paratype from Japan have 148–149 vertebrae (Böhlke 1982: 42); the specimens reported from the Galápagos by McCosker and Rosenblatt (1975: 422) have 136–142. This suggests that the two populations may not be conspecific
.
